titleStmt.title: By the King. James R. Whereas all reasonable means are to be used for the subsistence of our army, which cannot be better contrived than by encouraging such as shall bring any provision to our camp;
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benj. Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our camp neer Drogheda the fourteenth day of September 1689.".
Protecting persons bringing provisions or forage to the camp.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 189. of ction Our.
In this edition date at end of text reads: "... The fourteenth day of September 1689."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
